segment: Terms and Conditions    Please refer to the order terms below. If you have any further questions, please contact us.     Web orders will ship 5-7 business days from the time of purchase.   Any defective items purchased directly from Lodge are eligible for full refund or exchange by contacting customer service.   Shipping for returns/exchanges due to non-defect reasons (i.e. wrong size, color, no longer desired) will be the responsibility of the customer.   Items bought from retailers should be returned/exchanged at the place of purchase.   Transactions are transmitted using 128-bit secure socket layers (SSL) for up-to-date data protection

model_analysis.explanation: The segment mentions that transactions are transmitted using 128-bit secure socket layers (SSL), which is a measure for secure data transfer.

segment: Privacy Policy    This privacy policy has been compiled to better serve those who are concerned with how their 'Personally identifiable information' (PII) is being used online. PII, as used in US privacy law and information security, is information that can be used on its own or with other information to identify, contact, or locate a single person, or to identify an individual in context. Please read our privacy policy carefully to get a clear understanding of how we collect, use, protect or otherwise handle your Personally Identifiable Information in accordance with our website.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides a general introduction to the privacy policy, explaining the purpose of the document and the importance of personally identifiable information (PII). It does not provide specific details on practices or policies.

segment: What personal information do we collect from the people that visit our blog, website or app?   When ordering or registering on our site, as appropriate, you may be asked to enter your name, email address, mailing address, credit card information or other details to help you with your experience.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of personal information such as name, email address, mailing address, and credit card information from users who visit the website or app, categorizing it under 'Collect on website' with 'Contact' as the type of personal information collected.

segment: When do we collect information?   We collect information from you when you place an order or enter information on our site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that information is collected from users when they place an order or enter information on the website, indicating first-party collection on the website.

segment: How do we use your information?   We may use the information we collect from you when you register, make a purchase, sign up for our newsletter, respond to a survey or marketing communication, surf the website, or use certain other site features in the following ways:     To quickly process your transactions.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how user information is collected through various activities on the website and used to process transactions, indicating a basic service feature without specifying user choice options.

segment: How do we protect visitor information?   Our website is scanned on a regular basis for security holes and known vulnerabilities in order to make your visit to our site as safe as possible.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes regular scanning of the website for security holes and vulnerabilities, which is a part of a privacy/security program to protect visitor information.

segment: Your personal information is contained behind secured networks and is only accessible by a limited number of persons who have special access rights to such systems, and are required to keep the information confidential. In addition, all sensitive/credit information you supply is encrypted via Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of secured networks, limited access, and encryption to protect personal information, which falls under secure data storage.

segment: We implement a variety of security measures enters, submits, or accesses their information to maintain the safety of your personal information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the implementation of various security measures to protect personal information but does not specify what those measures are, making it a generic mention of data security.

segment: All transactions are processed through a gateway provider and are not stored or processed on our servers.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that transactions are processed through a gateway provider, ensuring secure data transfer and not storing or processing them on the company's servers.

segment: Do we use 'cookies'?   Yes. Cookies are small files that a site or its service provider transfers to your computer's hard drive through your Web browser (if you allow) that enables the site's or service provider's systems to recognize your browser and capture and remember certain information. For instance, we use cookies to help us remember and process the items in your shopping cart. They are also used to help us understand your preferences based on previous or current site activity, which enables us to provide you with improved services. We also use cookies to help us compile aggregate data about site traffic and site interaction so that we can offer better site experiences and tools in the future.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of cookies, which are collected on the website to recognize users and improve service. Users can control this through browser settings, and the purpose includes service operation and security enhancements.

segment: We use cookies to:     Help remember and process the items in the shopping cart.

model_analysis.explanation: The statement explains the use of cookies to remember and process items in a shopping cart, which is a basic service feature. It involves collecting cookies on the website implicitly and is relevant to users with accounts.

segment: You can choose to have your computer warn you each time a cookie is being sent, or you can choose to turn off all cookies. You do this through your browser (like Internet Explorer) settings. Each browser is a little different, so look at your browser's Help menu to learn the correct way to modify your cookies.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how users can control cookie collection through browser settings, which falls under first-party collection and browser/device privacy controls.

segment: If users disable cookies in their browser:   If you disable cookies off, some features will be disabled It will turn off some of the features that make your site experience more efficient and some of our services will not function properly. However, you can still place orders.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the user's ability to disable cookies through browser settings, which affects the functionality of the service, indicating a choice related to first-party use of cookies.

segment: Third Party Disclosure   We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer to outside parties your personally identifiable information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment explicitly states that the company does not sell, trade, or transfer personally identifiable information to outside parties.

segment: Third party links   We do not include or offer third party products or services on our website.

model_analysis.explanation: The policy clearly states that the website does not include or offer third-party products or services, indicating no third-party collection or sharing occurs.

segment: Google   Google's advertising requirements can be summed up by Google's Advertising Principles. They are put in place to provide a positive experience for users. https://support.google.com/adwordspolicy/answer/1316548?hl=en

model_analysis.explanation: The segment provides a general statement about Google's advertising principles without specific details on privacy practices, making it introductory or generic in nature.

segment: We have not enabled Google AdSense on our site but we may do so in the future.

model_analysis.explanation: The statement indicates a potential future action involving Google AdSense, which involves third-party sharing/collection, but does not specify current practices or details.

segment: California Online Privacy Protection Act   CalOPPA is the first state law in the nation to require commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. The law's reach stretches well beyond California to require a person or company in the United States (and conceivably the world) that operates websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a conspicuous privacy policy on its website stating exactly the information being collected and those individuals with whom it is being shared, and to comply with this policy. - See more at: http://consumercal.org/california-online-privacy-protection-act-caloppa/sthash.0FdRbT51.dpuf

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the California Online Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA), which specifically targets Californians by requiring websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a privacy policy.

segment: According to CalOPPA we agree to the following:

model_analysis.explanation: The segment references CalOPPA, which is a privacy regulation specific to residents of California, indicating that the policy addresses requirements for this audience.

segment: Users can visit our site anonymously

model_analysis.explanation: The statement indicates that users can visit the site without revealing their identity or creating an account, categorizing them as 'User without account'.

segment: Once this privacy policy is created, we will add a link to it on our home page, or as a minimum on the first significant page after entering our website.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that a link to the privacy policy will be added to the home page or a significant page on the website, which is a general notice to users.

segment: Our Privacy Policy link includes the word 'Privacy', and can be easily be found on the page specified above.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides a generic statement about the location of the privacy policy link, which is introductory information rather than specific privacy practices.

segment: Users will be notified of any privacy policy changes:     On our Privacy Policy Page

model_analysis.explanation: The statement indicates that users will be notified of privacy policy changes on the Privacy Policy Page, which aligns with a general notice in the privacy policy.

segment: Users are able to change their personal information:     By emailing us     By calling us     By logging in to their account

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the methods available for users to change their personal information, which falls under the 'Edit information' access type.

segment: How does our site handle do not track signals?   We honor do not track signals and do not track, plant cookies, or use advertising when a Do Not Track (DNT) browser mechanism is in place.

model_analysis.explanation: The policy explicitly states that the site honors Do Not Track signals by not tracking, planting cookies, or using advertising when a DNT mechanism is in place.

segment: Does our site allow third party behavioral tracking?   It's also important to note that we do not allow third party behavioral tracking

model_analysis.explanation: The segment clearly states that the site does not allow third party behavioral tracking.

segment: COPPA (Children Online Privacy Protection Act)   When it comes to the collection of personal information from children under 13, the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) puts parents in control. The Federal Trade Commission, the nation's consumer protection agency, enforces the COPPA Rule, which spells out what operators of websites and online services must do to protect children's privacy and safety online.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA), which is specifically focused on protecting the privacy and safety of children under 13 online. This categorization is appropriate as it addresses the privacy concerns and regulations related to a specific audience: children.

segment: We do not specifically market to children under 13.

model_analysis.explanation: The statement indicates that the company does not specifically target children under 13, which relates to specific audience considerations, particularly children.

segment: Fair Information Practices   The Fair Information Practices Principles form the backbone of privacy law in the United States and the concepts they include have played a significant role in the development of data protection laws around the globe. Understanding the Fair Information Practice Principles and how they should be implemented is critical to comply with the various privacy laws that protect personal information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment provides a general introduction to the Fair Information Practices Principles, emphasizing their importance in privacy law without detailing specific practices or policies.

segment: In order to be in line with Fair Information Practices we will take the following responsive action, should a data breach occur:

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses responsive actions in case of a data breach, which is related to data security measures but does not specify any particular security measure.

segment: We will notify the users via email     Within 7 business days

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that users will be notified via email, which is considered a personal notice.

segment: We will notify the users via in site notification     Within 7 business days

model_analysis.explanation: The statement specifies that users will be notified via an in-site notification, which aligns with the 'General notice on website' category.

segment: We also agree to the individual redress principle, which requires that individuals have a right to pursue legally enforceable rights against data collectors and processors who fail to adhere to the law. This principle requires not only that individuals have enforceable rights against data users, but also that individuals have recourse to courts or a government agency to investigate and/or prosecute non-compliance by data processors.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the right of individuals to seek legal recourse against data processors for non-compliance, aligning with the concept of user rights and access to enforcement mechanisms.

segment: Contacting Us   If there are any questions regarding this privacy policy you may contact us using the information below.   204 E. 5th Street   South Pittsburg, TN 37380   United States   info@lodgemfg.com   423.837.7181   Last Edited on 10/2014

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides contact information for users to reach out with questions regarding the privacy policy, categorizing it as privacy contact information.
